notes:
1. During the framing of the Indian Constitution, the Constituent Assembly held a total of eleven sessions, with sittings spread over for how many days? SSC MTS 13/11/2024 (2nd Shift)
Ans: 165 - 165. The Constituent Assembly of India began its first session on 9 December 1946 in the Constitution Hall (now Central Hall of Parliament). Over nearly three years, it held 11 sessions, meeting for 165 days, including 114 days focused on discussing the Draft Constitution.

2. The Indian Constitution has established _________. SSC CGL 10/09/2024 (1st Shift)
Ans: independent judicial system - independent judicial system: It means that the other organs of the government like the executive and legislature must not restrain the functioning of the judiciary in such a way that it is unable to do justice.

3. Who among the following, while praising the amending feature of the Indian Constitution said that ‘This variety in the amending process is wise but is rarely found’? SSC CGL 11/09/2024 (2nd Shift)
Ans: K C Wheare - K C Wheare was an Australian academic who was an expert on the constitutions of the British Commonwealth. He also described the Indian Constitution as Quasi federal. Granville Austin, a well-known scholar of the Indian Constitution, said, “The amending process has proved itself as one of the most ably conceived aspects of the constitution”. Ivor Jennings said that ‘India is a federation with a strong centralising tendency’.

4. Which of the following is NOT a feature of the Constitution of India? SSC CGL 18/09/2024 (2nd Shift)
Ans: Dual Citizenship - Dual Citizenship. India’s commitment to the rule of law is grounded in the Constitution which establishes India as a ‘Sovereign Socialist Secular Democratic Republic’ with a Parliamentary form of Government. Other key features: Federal system of governance between the Union and the States; Separation of powers between the three organs of the Government; free and fair elections; Equality before the law; A secular state that recognizes freedom of conscience and religion.

5. Which of the following statements are INCORRECT vis-à-vis features of the Indian Constitution? 1) The Constitution empowers the Prime Minister to proclaim three types of emergencies. 2) A reservation policy is there to uplift the disadvantaged sections of society. 3) The Supreme Court has no power of judicial review. 4) The Constitution provides for universal adult suffrage. SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (2nd shift)
Ans: 1 and 3 - 1 and 3. The Constitution empowers the President to proclaim three types of emergencies. National Emergency (Article 352), President’s Rule (State Emergency) (Article 356), Financial Emergency (Article 360).

6. Which of the following statement(s) is/are INCORRECT vis-a-vis features of the Indian Constitution? 1) Though India has a federal system, the Constitution does not mention the word 'federation'. 2) Article 5 of the Constitution says that the Parliament by law can create a new state. 3) On the subjects in the Union list, each State Legislature can enact laws for the State. 4)Both the Parliament and State Legislature can pass laws on subjects in concurrent list. SSC CHSL 03/07/2024 (2nd shift)
Ans: 2 and 3 - 2 and 3. Article 1 of the Indian Constitution defines India, also known as Bharat, as a union of states. Although the term "federation" is not explicitly used, India functions as a holding-together type of federation where power distribution among states can be unequal. The Parliament has exclusive authority to legislate on Union List subjects. Article 2 allows for the admission or establishment of new states, while Article 3 provides for the formation of new states and the alteration of existing states' areas, boundaries, or names.

7. The Indian Constitution came into force on ___ and is celebrated as Republic Day. SSC CHSL 03/07/2024 (2nd shift)
Ans: 26 Jan 1950 - 26 Jan 1950. The Constitution of India was adopted by the Constituent Assembly on 26th November 1949. The Drafting Committee, chaired by Dr. Bhimrao Ambedkar, was established on 29th August 1947. A total of 284 members signed the Constitution, which took 2 years, 11 months, and 18 days to draft.

8. Secularism is a feature of the Indian Constitution, which means: SSC CHSL 04/07/2024 (1st shift)
Ans: The State does not promote any religion. - In India, the term 'secularism' was introduced in the year 1976 of the 42nd Amendment of the Constitution.

9. In which year did the Indian Constitution declare Hindi in Devanagari script to be the official language of the Union? SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (4th shift)
Ans: 1949 - 1949. Under Article 343(1), the official language of the Union shall be Hindi in Devanagari script, while Section 3 of the Official Language Act, 1963 talks about the continuance of the English language for official purposes of the Union and for use in Parliament.

10. The Preamble of the Constitution describes India as: SSC CHSL 09/07/2024 (1st shift)
Ans: a secular state - A secular state. It does not consider anyone's religion as an official religion. India is a Sovereign Socialist Secular Democratic Republic with a Parliamentary form of government which      is federal in structure with unitary features. Atheist State - No belief in Gods. Unitary State - Central government holds complete authority. Federal State - Central and state governments share autonomy.

11. Which of the following word sequences is correct as per the Preamble to the Constitution ? SSC CHSL 10/07/2024 (3rd shift)
Ans: Sovereign, socialist, secular, democratic, republic - The words "Socialist" and "Secular" were added to the Preamble of the Indian Constitution by the 42nd Amendment in 1976. Before this, India was described as a Sovereign, Democratic, Republic, and after the amendment, it was changed to Sovereign, Socialist, Secular, Democratic, Republic.

12. In which of the following years was the National Anthem adopted in its Hindi version by the Constituent Assembly ? SSC CHSL 10/07/2024 (3rd shift)
Ans: 1950 - 1950. The National Anthem of India, "Jana-Gana-Mana," was originally composed in Bengali by Rabindranath Tagore and titled "Bharoto Bhagyo Bidhata." It was first publicly sung on December 27, 1911, at the Calcutta (now Kolkata) Session of the Indian National Congress. It was translated into Hindi by Captain Abid Ali and set to music by Captain Ram Singh.

13. When was the ‘The Objective Resolution’ moved by Pt. Jawahar Lal Nehru ? SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (1st shift)
Ans: 13 December 1946 - 13 December 1946. The Objective Resolution outlines the fundamental ideas and philosophy of our Constitution, defining the goals of the Constituent Assembly. It serves as the basis for the preamble of the Constitution. This important resolution was adopted by the Assembly on January 22, 1947.

14. Which of the following is NOT a basic feature of the Indian Constitution ? SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (1st shift)
Ans: Drawn from one source - Drawn from one source. The salient features of the Indian Constitution include: the lengthiest written constitution, drawn from various sources, a blend of rigidity and flexibility, a federal system with a unitary bias, a parliamentary form of government, a synthesis of parliamentary sovereignty and judicial supremacy, rule of law, an integrated and independent judiciary, fundamental rights, directive principles of state policy, fundamental duties, secularism, single citizenship, judicial review, and the basic structure doctrine.

15. Which of the following statements are correct in the context of the Indian Constitution? 1.There are three major organs of the government, namely Legislature, Executive and Judiciary. 2. A separation of functions rather than powers is followed. 3.All organs of the government are independent. SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (2nd shift)
Ans: 1 and 2 only - 1 and 2 only. In the context of the Indian Constitution: Legislative Function - Parliament (Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha) makes laws, with the President giving assent to bills. Executive Function - The Prime Minister and the Council of Ministers execute laws and are also part of the legislature, linking the two branches. Judicial Function - The judiciary interprets laws and administers justice, reviewing legislative and executive actions for constitutional compliance. This system fosters collaboration and interdependence among branches, with distinct functions but not complete separation of powers.

16. Who called the preamble of the Indian Constitution 'The Political Horoscope of our Constitution' ? Matriculation Level 21/06/2024 (Shift - 1)
Ans: Dr. KM Munshi - Dr. KM Munshi. He was a member of the Drafting Committee of the Indian Constitution. Other names for the preamble: Soul of the Constitution: By Thakurdas Bhargav. Identity card of the Constitution: By N.A. Palkhiwala. Keynote to the Constitution: By Sir Ernest Barker.

17. When was the preamble to the Indian Constitution amended ? Matriculation Level 26/06/2024 (Shift - 1)
Ans: 1976 - 1976. The Preamble of the Constitution was amended only once, in 1976, by the 42nd Constitutional Amendment. The terms 'Socialist', 'Secular', and 'Integrity' were added to the preamble. 'Socialist' and 'Secular' were added between 'Sovereign' and 'Democratic'. 'Unity of the Nation' was changed to 'Unity and Integrity of the Nation'.

18. When is Constitution Day observed in India ? Higher Secondary 24/06/2024 (Shift - 2)
Ans: 26 November - 26 November. The ‘Purna Swaraj’ resolution, meaning total independence, was passed by the Indian National Congress on 19 December 1929, during the Lahore session presided by Jawaharlal Nehru. The pledge for independence was publicly announced on 26 January 1930. Nehru, along with Congress members, marched to the banks of the Ravi, taking an oath not to rest until Purna Swaraj was achieved.

Ans: Bhim Rao Ambedkar - Bhim Rao Ambedkar. He played a pivotal role in drafting the Constitution of India, serving as the Chairman of the Constitution Drafting Committee. Gopinath Bordoloi was the first Chief Minister of Assam. Rajendra Prasad served as the first President of India. Paramasivan Subbarayan was the first Minister of Madras Presidency.

Ans: Pingali Venkayya - Pingali Venkayya :      He presented the original design of the Indian flag with red and green colors to Mahatma Gandhi in 1921. The National Flag was adopted by the Constituent Assembly of India on 22 July 1947.

24. Who among the following wrote in calligraphic style the Hindi version of the original Indian Constitution? SSC CHSL 10/08/2023 (2nd shift)
Ans: Vasant Krishan Vaidya - Vasant Krishan Vaidya. The original version of the constitution was beautified and decorated by artists from Shantiniketan including Nand Lal Bose and Beohar Rammanohar Sinha.

25. The structural part of the Indian Constitution is, to a large extent, derived from the Act of _____________. SSC CHSL 14/08/2023 (4th shift)
Ans: 1935 - 1935. Government of India Act, 1935 provides the establishment of an All India federation consisting of provinces and princely states as units. It divided the powers between the centre and units in terms of three lists- Federal list, provincial list and the concurrent list. Jawaharlal Nehru called it a “machine with strong brakes but no engine”. He also called it a “Charter of Slavery”.
